title: yhiaali3
author: yhiaali3
content: As in the title, is there a chrome extension to receive forum notifications?I do not know if there is such an add-on or not, of course I know that there is a bot on Telegram to receive notifications and I have been using it for a long time, but I need to know if there is an add-on for Chrome or Firefox browsers to receive notifications instead of the Telegram bot.I think such an add-on would be very useful, so I hope someone has information about the possibility of such an add-on in the forum to help me find it.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: As far as I know, there is no such add-on for any browser, and even if there were, I personally would not use it because I avoid any unnecessary add-ons in the browser. As you wrote yourself, there is a Telegram bot, and you can also receive notifications on your e-mail (at least as far as private messages are concerned).However, if that accessory means so much to you, you can order it from @mprep because he offers such accessories, among other things -> mprep's Web & Desktop Software Development Services

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: There is no chrome extension to receive notification, I have been using the telegram notification bot and it is very good and I make the links on of the telegram notification to be directly accessed by the browser when I click on it.You can try LoyceV notification bot too [new topic] LoyceV's notification bot

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Thank you allI haven't tried LoyceV's notification bot yetI'm using the SuperNotifier "V2" bot found in this thread:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5248878.0The bot works well and gives very good results, but I work on a laptop and use the Google Chrome browser. I installed Telegram (Windows desktop version) so that I receive notifications immediately instead of a mobile.But I always have to open Telegram to receive notifications, so I thought that installing the Google Chrome extension would be easier.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: yhiaali3 on January 26, 2023, 11:12:18 AMBut I always have to open Telegram to receive notifications, so I thought that installing the Google Chrome extension would be easier.The only extension I used was TryNinja's personal note. It was good but then when I started to have issue with cloudflare I had to reset the entire browser. With the reset I realized all notes were wiped. I did not find any interest to use the extension anymore. Extensions are fine as long as you do not need to change the browser or reset it.Come on theymos, we need an upgrade.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: Can you not rely on telegram notifications in browser? I'd assume chrome or Edge will deliver the best results for this (ie they might be able to give you a popup too).There's a way to access telegram over the Web where you scan a qr code and log in that way.

comments.author: drwhobox
comments.body: So far I don't find any extensions for bitcointalk that sends a notification. If someone develops an extension like that, this would be great to have on my browser. Actually, I searched for these kinds of software, and now I am convinced that there is none. I am also aware of telegram bot but I don't spend time on telegram and I keep my telegram notifications turned off. I just use the email notification for a long time and now I adopted this style of getting notified.

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: Pop Up and chrome notifications are very popular now if you are a subscriber of one's site, the community is divided on this unless we have one we can see if the notifications will be accepted by the majority of the forum members, the closest that we can get it is to click the box on the discussion if there is a new reply, but the notifications will only arrive on our email, this is a default setting of all SMF forum software.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: OP seems to be a fan of a Google extension or add-on. I always try to avoid utilizing extensions since I don't like having my online activities tracked. Since there are no other options, Metamask is being used exclusively. The better alternative, though, is a notification bot. Theymos won't likely create a Google extension, in my opinion. Many helpful developments are still pending.
